com.aevi.magstripe

Class MagStripeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.magstripe.MagStripeService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AeviService

    public class MagStripeService
extends java.lang.Object
implements AeviService
    The MagStripeService class provides an app with the ability to communicate with a mag stripe card reader. The request is done via a callback. This is done to make sure the application would not be blocked when it was waiting for a user to swipe a card. The onSuccess method will return the results and the onFailure an error code found in the MagStripeError class. 

     service.swipe(new OnSwipeCallback() {
   @Override
   public void onSuccess(MagStripeTracks result) {
     //handle result
   }
   @Override
   public void onFailure(int errorCode) {
     //handle error
   }
 });

    See Also:
    TerminalConfiguration.isMagStripeApiUsable()

      • COMPATIBILITY

        public static final Version COMPATIBILITY

    • Method Detail

      • swipe

        public void swipe(OnSwipeCallback callback)
        Request the reading of a mag stripe swipe. A callback is used to return the results or errors.
        Parameters:
        callback - a class containing an onSuccess and an onFailure method for processing the results.
        Throws:
        AeviServiceConnectionException - When unable to connect to the Mag Stripe service

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels an outstanding swipe request. Any outstanding swipe request will receive an on Failure call on the callback
        Throws:
        AeviServiceConnectionException - When unable to connect to the Mag Stripe service

      • createIntent

        public static android.content.Intent createIntent()
        Creates an Intent that can be used to bind the mag stripe service.
        Returns:
        an Intent that can be used to bind the mag stripe service.
